alert.note: Alert for Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 16 at 11:17PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Florida, including the following counties, Alachua and Marion. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1116 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gainesville, Citra, Melrose, Alachua, Hawthorne, Archer, Cross Creek, Rochelle, Newnans Lake, University Of Florida, Gainesville Airport, Sparr, Orange Heights, Anthony, Micanopy, Reddick, McIntosh, Flemington, Grove Park and Lochloosa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
